chargeHist.descr: Child Abuse - Intentionally Cause Great Bodily Harm

result.execSummary:
The defendant Calvin M. MATZ was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Great Harm, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To the Crime Victim Compensation Program.
Maintain fulltime employment, schooling or a combination of both.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Complete parenting classes.

Have no contact with the victim until authorized by his agent.

Defendant is to comply with all family court requirements.

timeConds.notes:
Under the Huber Law.  Court authorizes release not only for employment purposes but also for involvement in child care as found appropriate by the agent.  Court further orders transfer to either Calumet, Outagamie or Winnebago County jail.

Additional three (3) months county jail, under the Huber Law, stayed and to be imposed at the agent's discretion and upon order of the court.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Stipulation and Order to Amend Bail Term.
It is hereby ordered that the defendant shall have visitation supervised by Sarah Chimileski, G.M.M.'s mother, on the minor's birthday, June 4, 2015 from 2:00 p.m. until 8:00 p.m.
Cover letter.
Order Denying Motion to Modify Bail.

MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL - 
The parties argue the motion.
EXHIBIT 1, copy of psychological evaluation, letter from victims mother, photos of residence and report from Freedom Life Skills program, marked (color photos scanned in memorandum on 05-04-2015).
The Court comments and finds deciding on contact with the victim now is premature.  The defendant is to be sentenced next month and the Court would like to see what is recommended in the Presentence Report as far as contact with the victim is concerned.  
State to draft order.
Minutes.

State files an Amended Information charging Physical abuse of child-recklessly cause great bodily harm, contrary to Section 948.03(3)(a) of the Wisconsin Statutes.  No contest plea to the amended charge.  Convicted.  Court orders a pre-sentence investigation report to be completed by DOC.  Report to be filed by 06-05-15.  Sentencing hearing set for 06-15-15 at 3:00 p.m.  Defendant is ordered to report to Sheriff's Department to provide DNA sample.

Defendant in custody.   
The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of child abuse.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 08-18-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $7,500.00 cash with the condition that defendant is to have no contact with G.M.M., DOB: 06-04-2014.  Bail not furnished.  Defendant remanded to the county jail.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
